title: Differential Equations II
description: Qualitative theory of ordinary differential equations: Existence and Uniqueness Theorem, phase portraits, limit sets, stability of fixed points and periodic orbits, energy functions, Poincare-Bendixson Theorem, Poincare maps, bifurcations, attractors, chaos. 4 lectures.
prerequisites: MATH 206 and MATH 242, or MATH 241 and MATH 244
